Package Menu_package.Menus

Class GenericMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • Menu_package.Menus.GenericMenu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlaCarteMenu, PromoMenu
    public abstract class GenericMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for subclasses that handles operation relating to different types of Menu Items.
    See Also:
    AlaCarteMenu, PromoMenu

    • Method Detail

      • getItem

        public Item getItem​(int number,
                    java.lang.String typeCategory,
                    java.lang.String itemType)
        Returns Item object by the Item Category, Type and the numbering (number). For explanation purposes, numbering will be referred to as 'i'. 'i' indicates the position of the Item, with the Item Type specified. This method will return the 'i'th Item of the Item type specified. For e.g., if Type = "Appetiser", number = 2, then the 2nd Item of Type "Appetiser" wil be returned.
        Parameters:
        number - Position of Item, of the specified Item Type.
        typeCategory - Item Category, to indicate which Item Category the Item (to be returned) is from.
        itemType - Item Type, to indicate which Item Type the Item (to be returned) is of.
        Returns:
        Item Item object under Item Category, of Item Type, and numbering specified.

      • findItemTypeCategory

        public java.lang.String findItemTypeCategory​(java.lang.String itemType)
        Abstract method for subclasses to get Item Category of the Item Type specified.
        Parameters:
        itemType - Item Type
        Returns:
        String Item Type
        See Also:
        AlaCarteMenu.findItemTypeCategory(String itemType), PromoMenu.findItemTypeCategory(String itemType)

      • allocateItem

        public int allocateItem​(Item menuItem,
                        java.lang.String itemType)
        Abstract method for subclasses to add Item object into ArrayList according to the Item Type.
        Parameters:
        menuItem - Item Object to be added
        itemType - Item Type of the Item object to be added
        Returns:
        int Return positive integer if success, negative if failure (refer to above method links)
        See Also:
        AlaCarteMenu.allocateItem(Item menuItem, String itemType), PromoMenu.allocateItem(Item menuItem, String itemType)

      • findFirstTypeOccurrence

        public int findFirstTypeOccurrence​(java.lang.String typeCategory,
                                   java.lang.String itemType)
        Abstract method for subclasses to find first occurrence index of a specified Item Type in ArrayList that stores Items under Item Category specified.
        Parameters:
        typeCategory - Item Category
        itemType - Item Type
        Returns:
        int Return positive integer if success, negative if failure (refer to above method links)
        See Also:
        AlaCarteMenu.findFirstTypeOccurrence(String typeCategory, String itemType), PromoMenu.findFirstTypeOccurrence(String typeCategory, String itemType)

        itemType - Item Type

      • add

        public int add​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String itemType,
               java.lang.String typeCategory,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> description,
               float price,
               int stock)
        Add Item with specified attributes, to the csv file given (as the list of information of all Menu Items and Set)
        Parameters:
        name - Item name
        itemType - Item Type
        typeCategory - Item Category
        description - Item description
        price - Item price
        stock - Item stock
        Returns:
        int Returns 1 to indicate successful addition of Item to csv, negative integer to indicate failure

      • remove

        public void remove​(Item item)
        Remove Item from the csv file (that contains information of all Items and Set Menu)
        Parameters:
        item - Item to be removed

      • getItemToBeRemoved

        public Item getItemToBeRemoved​(int number,
                               java.lang.String typeCategory,
                               java.lang.String itemType)
        Get the specified Item according to the type category, Item type, the numbering of the Item in the Menu display, to prepare for removal of the Item.
        Parameters:
        number - Numbering of the Item in the Menu display
        typeCategory - Item Category of specified Item
        itemType - Item Type of specified Item
        Returns:
        Item Item to be removed

      • updateItem

        public void updateItem​(int number,
                       java.lang.String typeCategory,
                       java.lang.String itemType,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateInfo)
        Update the specified Item's attribute according to the "choice" in updateInfo. All other parameters (other than updateInfo) are used to locate the Item in the ArrayList of Items. "Choice" refers to the first element of updateInfo and it is a String number. If the first element is: "1" - change Item name "2" - change Item Type "3" - change Item description "4" - change Item price "5" - change Item stock
        Parameters:
        number - Numbering of the Item in the Menu display
        typeCategory - Item Category of specified Item
        itemType - Item Type of specified Item
        updateInfo - ArrayList that contains the "choice" (that indicates which Item attributes to change), and information to replace the specified Item attribute

      • findLongestStringSize

        public int findLongestStringSize​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> itemsNamesTypesList)
        Return length of the longest String to be displayed (in a single line) in the Menu display. This is to format the display positioning of the Menu's words and headers.
        Parameters:
        itemsNamesTypesList - ArrayList that contains all Strings that will be displayed in the Menu. The max length out of these Strings will be returned.
        Returns:
        int Length of the longest String to be displayed in a single line.

      • getLongestStringSize

        public int getLongestStringSize()
        Returns the longest String size (to be displayed in a single line in the Menu display), stored in this class.
        Returns:
        int Longest String size
